First sober Christmas here. Thanks for the thread. Managed to control the craving with my wife drinking and while out at a nice steakhouse for Christmas Eve. So far so good.

All of this for an ounce of cannabis, seriously? Not even crack cocaine or methamphetamine or heroin? Some weed that you can drive a few hours north and buy at the store while you get your groceries on the way home? Fucking hell I can't wrap my head around the absurdity of this situation, or the many similar no-knock raids. By the time you're awake enough and cognizant of what is going on, it's too late. You've already reacted based on the limited sensory information you have. I feel bad for the police officers ordered to do this stupid shit, and I feel bad for the families that have to deal with the fallout from this stupid shit. Whoever gave the order to do this should lose their job immediately for i Poor cops get fired upon and risk their lives FOR NO REASON, and this poor dude gets to deal with serious but bullshit charges for defending his home and family. In America. Fuckin' hell, man.

The visual and sensory highs are the best part. That sucks. It's better than doing more than a comfortable high though. I did not like the way I felt when I ate 3/4 of an 1/8. My visuals were way too intense, the people I was with not close friends, so I couldn't relax and trip in front of them. I just tripped out. I laid on the ground outside of their apartment and just tripped...they didn't tell me to move or really mess with me at all- I'm glad they didn't start stressing about cops, they just let me be.

These are people who will agree to for dinner and then will flake out at the last minute to go get drunk, leaving you sitting at a table with the only 2 non-alcoholic friends you have with food laid out.

No. That's a vague appeal to the public. You can't extrapolate anything significant from this post. No shit you should be careful with psychedelic drugs. What does "a little more careful" mean? He needs to be more specific, and without any evidence and proper context, there's nothing of value to be drawn here.
Some one, here, once said; "I find it is easier to manage sobriety than it is to manage moderation." So, every time I think I can moderate my drinking I recall this phrase.
Point: L doesn't and cannot make crime disappear. There will always be shitbirds.

I have tried to single out exactly what it is that went wrong when it happened, from being tired, eating sugar, nicotine, stressful events whilst tripping, but in the end I don't really know. Shits unpredictable. DMT is perfect because of the reduced duration, but ask the same I'm going to take a nice long break I'm actually really looking forward to that

Hi there, on stopdrinking we ask people to speak from their experience and to not give direct advice. Would you be willing to amend your fit with the guidelines, i.e. 'what has worked for me has been...'?
Cierra Hill just was talking bout this.

Thanks Vervain. I promise to do my damndest on this and not make it cheesy and unrealistic. You might...might...be surprised when it's done. I'll PM you with the Kindle link if that's ok (as far as forum rules go). I'm looking at this as kind of like an actor who's not a drug user but whose got to play one and make it convincing and moving and realistic for the audience...only the 'acting' is done on the page. Should he or she not do that role since they're not personally addicted? Mehhh. I don't think so. But, there again, it will all come down to talent and thorough research of the life experiences of the character. And plus, the story's not being told from the addicted character's POV. It's being told from her non-addicted daughter's POV, long after the fact, so the narrative approach is a bit different. It'll give me some wiggle room, as they say.
